rules: Rule1: If the trainer uses a clicker, then it is not the case that the trainer uses a whip.
Rule2: Whenever the tiger follows a cue, then the following holds: if the trainer gives a treat, the trainer uses a clicker.
Rule3: Under the condition that the tiger follows a gesture, then the following holds: if the trainer gives a treat, the trainer uses a clicker.
Rule4: The tiger is ready or the tiger is resting.
Rule5: Provided that the tiger is resting, then either the tiger follows a cue or the tiger follows a gesture.
Rule6: The tiger is fed or the tiger is treated.
Rule7: If the tiger is treated, then the tiger is not hungry.
Rule8: Under the condition that the trainer uses a target, then it is not the case that the trainer uses a net.
Rule9: The tiger is calm or the tiger is not distracted.
Rule10: If it is not the case that (if the tiger is ready, then either the tiger follows a cue or the tiger follows a gesture), then the trainer is confused.
Rule11: Provided that it is not the case that (if the tiger is ready, then either the tiger follows a cue or the tiger follows a gesture), then the trainer is not confused.
Rule12: Under the condition that it is not the case that (if the tiger is fed, then the tiger is not hungry), the trainer uses a net.

Rule13: Provided that it is not the case that (if the tiger is trained, then (if it is not the case that (if the tiger is fed, then the tiger is not hungry), the trainer uses a target)), the tiger is distracted.
Rule14: Under the condition that it is not the case that (if the tiger performs, then the audience applauds), the trainer uses a whip.
Rule15: If it is not the case that (if the tiger performs, then the audience applauds), the trainer gives a treat.
Rule16: Under the condition that the audience does not applaud, the tiger is hungry.
facts: Fact3: The tiger is not calm.
